On Apr 29, 2004, at 11:40 AM, John Lindwall wrote:
> Does anyone out there actually use Abbot?

Not only are folks using it (see

http://sourceforge.net/forum/?group_id=50939
http://sourceforge.net/mail/?group_id=50939

) but folks are extending it (not just @ IBM, see

Vincent Massol 2004-04-28 18:58 (for testing Java Web Start)
> I'm actually doing exactly this on my project at work. We have even
> developed a Maven plugin to make the whole process simple. I'll
> commit it this week end in the Maven CVS.

> Here's the strategy we use:
> - download the application's JNLP file
> - generate a modified JNLP file with the following modifications:
>   - addition of abbot jars using a file:// scheme
>   - replacing the application main class by our Abbot Test Launcher
>     class (more below)
>   - adding a few properties to control what test to run
> - start javaws using the modified JNLP file

> The Abbot Test Launcher class we have written simply uses the JUnit
> Ant task to start the tests (thus from within the JVM started by
> webstart). It acts as a JUnit test runner.

) and writing about it (see

http://www.wiley.com/WileyCDA/WileyTitle/productCd-0764556177,descCd-tableOfContents.html

)
